reviews.text: We chose this becuase we wantyed it to be child friendly. Unfortunately there was a massive conference on and it was full of snooty business men who have no time for small children who cant walk too fast.
reviews.title: Not as child friendly as expected

likes.liked: — Looks fantastic from outside and free bus to park
likes.disliked: — Long walk to room and business men everywhere

reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely if you get in early (7.45) or else there is a massive queue. And the characters in the foyer is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect Disney Atmosphere

likes.liked: — The exterior made you feel you really were in a New England palace!
likes.disliked: — The restaurants are VERY expensive - 100eu for dinner for 2 adults and 1 child

reviews.text: I do think you need to speak a little french for both the hotel and parks.
reviews.title: Disney but with a French twist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also I saw a mouse run across the floor in the restaurant - although the hotel was very clean.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: The room was spacious and well furnished but was a major trek from reception ( a good 10 mins) with a tired 3 yr old.
reviews.title: Very busy

reviews.text: Having paid 50% off thanks to a special offer I cannot complain but I would not pay full price to stay here I think. The hotel looks nice outside and in the lobby, and the restaurants, but the rooms, like many reviewers have said, do need deep cleaning and renovation. The beds however are very comfy!
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel but rooms need deep cleaning

reviews.text: You can walk to the parks or take the free shuttle bus from the parking if the weather doesn't help. Overall an ok stay. Had dinner at the Sequoia Lodge and it looked cosier and better kept.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Hotel is very impressive on arrival. We stayed on the Admiral Floor, check in was efficient and quick, friendly reception staff. The room had two double beds not a huge room but was sufficient for the four nights we stayed. Rooms were clean a little bit of tlc would not go amiss but as it's a 3 star hotel and centrally located we did not expect luxurious surroundings. Centrally located only a 10 min walk to the parks and the train at 2 euro per person stops right outside the hotel if you are not feeling too energetic first thing. Breakfast was continental and plentiful, very busy at certain times but que to be seated moved very quickly so no complaints. We did not have dinner or snacks so unable to comment on the food, soft drinks and alcohol very expensive so we got a taxi into the village and stocked up on beverages and pringles etc which adults and kids enjoyed as late night snacks and saved a lot of money! You can use the subway which is between the village and the parks and the supermarket is only one stop away. It is in a beautiful shopping mall which unfortuately we did not have time to look around but pharmacy is there if travelling with children handy to be aware of as none based in the Disney Village or Park. The Saturday and Sunday in the park was extremely busy and the que's were very long some waiting times were 1 and half hours or more. I would advise booking fast pass tickets if possible as personally I would be reluctant to wait that long for five min on the attractions. Overall a very pleasurable 1st visit to Eurodisney, as I said the Hotel is what it is and we spent most of our time out and about so it was more than adaquate for our time there. I look forward to a return visit in the future Enjoy!
reviews.title: RECENT TRIP 18TH NOVEMBER 3NIGHTS

reviews.text: Hi all disney guests!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at Newport !

reviews.text: having just returned from another visit at The Newport Bay just wanted to express some hints and tips!
reviews.title: nothing fancy here......just average

reviews.text: We had a 3 night break at this hotel. My children aged 5 & 10 loved the room, it was quite spacious and they especially liked the bedtime stories that they could listen to on the tv which was a smashing way to finish the day off. There weren't any tea making facilities, but probably the time we spent in the room this wasn't a major concern. We had dinner one evening in the conference room in the hotel (as the restaurants were being renovated) - this I wasn't impressed with as food wasn't hot and not much choice for the kids, so as we'd booked half board (highly recommend this) we booked a table at Cafe Mickey ( a few minutes walk from the hotel) which was fab! The breakfast was continental which was really nice, one thing I would say is when you book your time slot for breakfast (you do this when you check in) then the 8am slot is by far the best - no queues, but by 8.45am be prepared to queue!!
reviews.title: Very impressive hotel from the outside

reviews.text: This is the first review I have written after reading some bad reviews on here I didn't know what to expect but I can honestly say this hotel is great I had no problems during my stay please don't be put off if you have booked to stay here. The hotel bedrooms were spotless beds made each day and fresh towels left a travel cot was in our room even though we hadn't requested one. I didn't notice any un usual smells in the hotel yes its busy but it is a very large hotel. I certainly did not see any mice during our stay. We arrived around 3:45 pm there was only two other families in front of us check in took around 5 minutes all the staff I spoke to were very polite and helpful even though my french is limited. There were long queues for breakfast but that is to be expected of a hotel of this size we are looking to go back to disney land and will stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 day stay at this hotel
reviews.title: Nice hotel great views just needs a few tweeks

reviews.text: My wife had booked it and we had a perfect view for the firework display.
reviews.title: Come on Disney.... you can do better

reviews.text: 6th floor, admiral level with a balcony,
reviews.title: Nice hotel,rude staff

reviews.text: We have just come back from the Newport Bay hotel, we stayed for 4 nights and I have to say we had a fantastic time in Disney, however the last time we stayed in the Newport Bay everything was fantastic, this time however I have to say we found the rooms a little tired and worn, the tiles in the bathroom were black in the joints, the minibar was broken and looked like someone had been at it with a hammer, the bathroom floor was not cleaned in the day and we had to ring down to reception to get a hair dryer. The entrance to the hotel and the bars looked lovely I just dont know what has happened to the rooms also the corridors had a very musty smell to them, I have to agree with another guest on your site who said the entrance and bars did not match the corridors and the rooms. We had a lake view room withe a balcony (that was nice) and it was not cheap. I think the hotel is in need of a facelift and fast.
reviews.title: ok, but not great

likes.disliked: — state of room, peeling wallpaper stained bathroom tiles, tired looking

reviews.text: Disneyland itself was a fantastic holiday and we are going back again next year but staying at the Disneyland hotel,here's hoping for a room without peeling wallpaper.
reviews.title: It's no Hilton
Fantastic!!
reviews.text: The room was very plain. If you need an iron or blow dryer you need to call housekeeping. They delivered in a timely manner. No coffee maker either but that might be the way it is in France. This is definitely not the hotel to stay at if you want to watch TV all day. There were only two or three English channels and the remote control didn't have up and down arrows to change the channel - you have to enter the channel number. The entrance was nice but you have to climb stairs with your luggage or take a tiny elevator to the lobby. We had a storage room directly across the hall and the door constantly opened and closed (button was stuck or something). It was quite annoying while trying to sleep. It took about 24 hours to have that repaired. The bed was comfortable enough but overall it was nothing fancy. Dinner in the hotel restraunt was great but very expensive. Pistachio creme brule was amazing.
Just returned from a wonderful holiday at this hotel.
reviews.title: Unclean and not family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and very helpful could not do enough for us. We had a rooms on the admiral floor which was in the main building and were very clean, the only thing was they were very hot and could not turn the heat down!!.
reviews.title: Exclent

reviews.text: Not impressed. It's basically a 2 1/2 star hotel charging prices for the real thing.
reviews.title: 2 1/2 Star Hotel for the price of a 5 Star
Drop the Dixieland Muzak!
reviews.text: -Booking office incompetent and unhelpful
-Most of the counters were constantly understaffed, waiting times at the "superior" admirals floor reception up to 20 minutes
reviews.title: Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The honeymoon suite was amazing. The staff were very friendly

reviews.text: -half of their bars closed in the evening (in high season with a hotel bursting of guests) so you have to fight for a table to get a night-cap
reviews.title: Nice Setting

reviews.text: -Bus to station and park runs every 20 minutes (despite other information) and is bursting full once if finally shows up
reviews.title: Half-hearted attempt at Florida

reviews.text: This hotel is massive! It's huge. The team members are very kind and helpfull, but this hotel remains one big factory. And if you do not like waiting times, avoid bankholidays, weekends. I had to wait in line for more then 30 minutes for breakfast, even at 5 elevators, you'll need to wait somethimes 3 to 5 minutes. It's ideally located at 10 minutes walk from Disneyland and has a private carparking space. Do not expect to see great rooms. The room i had was ok but nothing more, nothing less.
reviews.title: Big-bigger-biggest

reviews.text: Although Disney is à family lesuren destination both Newport Bay and the Hotel New York have a lot of meeting rooms and thuis several business travellers Will visit this spot.
reviews.title: Not for business travellers!

reviews.text: The rooms are worn out which makers sense with all the families staying there. in the morning you have to wait in line for breakfast and the massive breakfast room has very litle choice of breakfast variety. Next to IT for dinner you can decide to again wait in line or go to one of the diners in Disney village and wait in line over there.
reviews.title: I don't call it a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was truly releved to leave this place after 2 full days!
reviews.title: Great hotel let down by its shabbiness

reviews.text: So for leisure/family travel, ok a yes, but for Business travel abolutely à NO!!!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous 2 night stay!

reviews.text: We stayed two nights from 18-20 November, 2011. The man at the gate upon arrival was not very welcome when we arrived and he actually was the first French who started to "scream" at us (a few more would follow after him, we noticed during the next days). When I said to him, "well good morning to you too" and "how are you today" he calmed down a bit. So that`s how Disney welcomes their guest at the Disney New Port Bay Hotel... hmm.
reviews.title: Big hotel, nothing fancy

reviews.text: After we managed to get to the reception from the huge parking lot we could check-in after a few minutes. No complaints about check-in. Everything was explained in a friendly way.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time had by all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room we got was on the first floor, it was ok but a bit shabby and for some parts in need of repair. No Flatscreen, just an ordinary TV at least 15 years old. Airco unit was broken, and therefore we had to sleep the first night with the airco on. Disappoiting that, the next day, after we complained at the reception the problem was still not fixed when we came back. So also the second night we had to sleep with the airco on. Has it got to do with the French way of life or was it the arrogance of Disney not to repair the unit of the airco in the room upon complaints of its guests? I will never know.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it!

reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel on the ground level can be busy, prepare to wait 10 to 15 minutes to be seated in the morning. Variety of food was nothing special, although everything was there. Unfortunately more choises in slices of meat for bread than cheese (no slices). Are we in France, or not?
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - be prepared to que!!

reviews.text: During breakfast it was the only time when I saw friendly people, the Dutch waiter and the French lady who welcomed us before we got seated.
reviews.title: Scotland

reviews.text: Have stay at the New York before but thought we would try the Newport Bay. I have a child under 3 in a buggy to get from the room to breakfast was two lifts. The hotel was full of conference delegates that just pushed the kids out of the way. Would not go back again.
reviews.title: Not buggy friendly

reviews.text: My sister and I booked two nights here late September. We had just spent three days in Paris at a very nice hotel (Hotel Muguet) and after the hustle and bustle of the city, we were hoping for a relaxing stay at the Newport Bay Club, with more American style amenities (like space) and service. I had booked a 'lakefront' room on the DLP website (classic package, includes breafast and tickets to the two parks), hoping like everyone else for a room facing the lake. Upon entering the room, we smelled cigarette smoke. Very unpleasant for non-smokers and for the fact that my sinuses were acting up. As for the view of the lake - I had to crane my head out to the right to see it. We told reception about the smoke smell and a staff member checked that it was a non-smoking room (tiny sign outside the door). He said - "oh it's just that probably the person before smoked - we will treat the room and it usually goes away" . I asked if they had another room and they said no, but we could try tomorrow. I was rather disappointed with this level of service, but I didn't want to spoil things, so I trusted in their smoke treatment. We went off to enjoy the park and did find the room smelt a little better on our return in the evening, but the cig smoke seemed a more permanent feature. That night, I saw a cigarette burn in the night-table and one on the comforter! I should have called them up right away to show them and demand a new room, but tiredness kicked in and we went to bed.
reviews.title: Disappointed
excellent holiday!!!
reviews.text: The next morning, they again said they had no rooms, which seemed incredible to us, considering that the hotel seemed so quiet and half empty to us at the time.

The food in the restaurant (Yacht Club) is very good to excellent, but again some staff were unfriendly (exept for the two waitresses who served us on the two nights we ate there). On the second night, I paid in cash, slipping the total in the leather folder; our waitress took the folder, and we assumed that she would bring it up to the proper counter. We left saying good-bye, only for the hostess to run after us in the lobby to ask if we would like to pay now! I said we paid in cash. She said OK and went back to the desk - I went over to check if all was OK to see the waitress hand the leather folder to the hostess. It was a mis-understanding, but most guests don't expect to be accused of not paying considering they have all your credit card details. She didn't really apologise, just waved an OK.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.text: One morning, I went to reception to ask if they could charge my cell phone for me. The girl at the desk sent me to the shop. After waiting ten minutes on line to ask there, the girl there said no. I then went to the concierge desk and he said no. I mentioned that the women at reception sent me to the shop, thereby wasting my time. He hardly apologized.
reviews.title: Magical holiday

likes.liked: — Clean and tidy and great breakfast
likes.disliked: — Early checking out of 11.00am, would have been better at about 2.00pm
